New Records: Cade Cunningham had 32 points and nine assists, helping the Pistons reach.500 for the first time since 2019
Key Match Events: Tim Hardaway Jr. tied the game with a jumper and later hit a three-pointer to give the Pistons the lead
Jalen Duren's putback restored the four-point lead after Portland's Deandre Ayton dunked with 49.5 seconds left
Pre-Game Insights: The Blazers led by 22 points in the first half but struggled in the second half
Portland outshot Detroit 53.3% to 44.7% from the floor but had a 17-7 edge in offensive rebounds
Post-Match Reflections: The Pistons' win marked a rare.500 record since 2019, a significant achievement for the team
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Blazers had a strong first half but couldn't sustain their momentum in the second half
The Pistons' defensive efforts and free-throw accuracy were key to their victory
